title: Giving older champions more lines?
body:
Don't know if this is the right board, but it seems like it may be due to actually being involved with the story. I was looking at some older champions, particularly those that aren't slated for reworks soon (Yorick, Ryze, Warwick) and noticed a lot of them don't really have that many vocal lines in game. And with changes in the lore, some quotes make even less sense, mainly everything involving summoners.

Main one that got me thinking was {{champion:103}}  since she's my main. She doesn't have that many vocal lines, and the ones she does have make her out to be a fairly ruthless predator with an attractive voice and body. But in more recent lore pieces, it's been said that she only wants to take her humanity from those that don't need it (And again, Noxus made out to be the bad guys, but that's a different can of worms) and that she does feel guilty about what she's done. 

Will some older champions who aren't getting reworked ever get new lines to keep them up-to-date with the current lore of the game?

The issue is essentially how much work Riot would have to do for such a marginal gain. Adding VO lines involves writing them (a fairly lengthy process), re-hiring the original voice actor, getting them in the studio, having them record lines, localizing the lines to work in different languages (which involves more VAs), and finally patching them in. It's just not worth it for such a small gain. 

At some point, every champion will have been reworked - and at that point, they'll all have had updated VOs. Be patient, friend.

A big problem with this is that for a lot of these old, OLD champs?  The VA's aren't even known.  There's a great interview somewhere (Wish I could find it) with the voice of Ashe where she mentions she didn't even remember being in the game until she played it, heard Ashe's voice, and was like "Oh, wait a minute."  

Before League was the biggest game in the world, it was the product of a tiny studio trying to sort of get in on a market that at the time was just DOTA 1.  A lot of these old VA's weren't Matthew Mercer or Troy Baker, they were probably almost literally "Some guy on the street who kinda sounded like a good Mad Chemist".  Riot might not have any way to contact them.

For a lot of them you'd potentially have to redo the whole voiceover with a new actor, and a lot of fans wouldn't like that.  Case in point, Nasus.  Old Nasus was widely considered the best VA in the League, but when it came time for his VU, the actor had died.  So they had to get someone new, and a lot of fans were upset that the old VA was just kinda...washed away.  That's sort of a special case because the guy was literally dead, but I was pretty bummed when we lost old GP, for example.  It's just a tricky subject.
